title: Bug of distributed parameter synchronization, when some parameters are not used.
body_html:
Issue description

If I define a Parameter in the model, which is not used. Parameters of the model are not synchronous correctly, When using distributed pytorch.

Code example

class Model(torch.nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        w1 = torch.nn.Parameter(size)
        ......
        w8 = torch.nn.Parameter(size)

    def forward(self, input):
         """ w1 is not used ""

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): *
  • OS: linux
  • PyTorch version: 0.4
  • Python version: 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda 8
  • GPU models and configuration: *
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): *
  • CMake version: *
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries: *

body:
## Issue description

If I define a Parameter in the model, which is not used. Parameters of the model are not synchronous correctly, When using distributed pytorch.

## Code example

```
class Model(torch.nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        w1 = torch.nn.Parameter(size)
        ......
        w8 = torch.nn.Parameter(size)

    def forward(self, input):
         """ w1 is not used ""
```

## System Info
- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): *
- OS: linux
- PyTorch version: 0.4
- Python version: 2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda 8
- GPU models and configuration: *
- GCC version (if compiling from source): *
- CMake version: *
- Versions of any other relevant libraries: *
